lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
boolean exit = Parser.parse(fullCommand, tasks, ui, storage);
public static boolean parse(String in, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-( ");

* @return True if input is within scope of the program, false otherwise.
System.out.println("I have added tasks from your previous session to the current list");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");

System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list");

* @throws DukeException An exception unique to duke.Duke.

throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list");
* Adds an event task to the list.
* @throws DukeException An exception unique to duke.Duke.
public void event(String in) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list");
* Adds a to-do task to the list.
* @throws DukeException An exception unique to duke.Duke.
public void todo(String in) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");  // Output user input
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list");
System.out.println("What may I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
